commit.message: Feat: adding the password confirmation. Fixing the ESLint errors
Working on the user and role table
Refactor: working on the role table modals
Refactor: Removing the debug logging and FIXME

nodes.bodyText: What's the FIXME in regards to?
Not sure if you are intending to keep the logs here or not.
Did we want to do a new line here?
Can't you use the modified PopUp component here?
Would a ternary operator be allowed here or is it not allowed due to async functions?
The formatting here is a little strange to me. Edit on its own line would be a little clearer
Same as above. Looks strange having this on its own line.
I think having the lines not starting with . makes more sense. My IDE was doing this to me automatically with the save actions. Perhaps you are having the same issue?
more lines starting with a period
Do we actually want this set to false here?
I think we want to negate the matching by default, otherwise, the user could save a blank password, no?

commit.message: Refactor: Updating based on PR feedback.
Refactor: Adding the missing fetching booleans

nodes.bodyText: Should this be wrapped in parenthesis as well?
Everywhere this component is used is wrapped in a form element correct? Otherwise the submit won't work.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,20 +1,18 @@
 import React from 'react';
 import PropTypes from 'prop-types';
 
-const SubmitButton = ({ onClick, children, id }) => (
-    <button id={id} className="btn btn-md btn-primary" type="submit" onClick={onClick}>{children}</button>
+const SubmitButton = ({ children, id }) => (
+    <button id={id} className="btn btn-md btn-primary" type="submit">{children}</button>

commit.message: Refactor: Wrapping the CancelButton in parenthesis.
